summary: This is an FBI internal request form from the Miami field office to the Records Management Division and Special Technologies and Applications Office, requesting scanning and automation assistance for telephone records related to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez. The document reveals Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager, attempted to sell an address book believed to contain contact information for additional underage victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of an FBI obstruction of justice case opened in October 2009. He came into possession of an address book with names and numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein and attempted to sell it to an undercover employee (UCE).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: Identified as the employer of Alfredo Rodriguez and the central figure in a child prostitution case. The address book Rodriguez possessed is believed to contain information about his additional underage victims.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez possessed an address book believed to contain information on Epstein's underage victims and attempted to sell it rather than comply with legal obligations.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction case against Rodriguez
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Telephone records collection period
events.description: Telephone records were generated between September 1, 2001, and the present (circa 2010) for the investigation.

events.title: Rodriguez attempts to sell victim address book
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and telephone numbers of potential underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein to an undercover employee (UCE), instead of turning it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas.

locations: Winchester, Virginia 22602 (DocLab - Telephone Application Audit Processing Team, Federal Bureau of Investigation, 170 Marcel Drive)
keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager and butler, was the subject of an FBI obstruction of justice case opened in October 2009.
Rodriguez came into possession of an address book containing names and telephone numbers believed to be additional, previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

Rodriguez attempted to sell the address book to an undercover employee (UCE) rather than turn it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas issued during pending civil litigation.

The FBI was processing telephone records (target number 310-457-9894) from the address book, believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential underage victims, for incorporation into its Telephone Application (TA) investigative tool.

The document is an internal FBI request for scanning and automation assistance, indicating an active investigative effort to digitize and analyze evidence related to the Epstein case and Rodriguez's obstruction.
